::Firearm::

Firearm walks up to Hysteria, looking at the consoles. "And to think 
these were in perfect shape when we got here."

He shakes his head. "How bad's the damage?"




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@h...> wrote:
> (I'm getting e-mails out of order, late, or not at all. So if I 
miss 
> something then I just want to apologize^_^ *Kicks server and chucks 
comp out 
> the window* There, maybe it'll work now:P *sigh* It also seems I've 
gotten 
> sick as well, kindof a borderline flu thing. *groan*)
> 
> Hysteria/Tavatron
> 
> Hysteria:
> 
> Hysteria works her way across the bridge. The lights flicker once, 
then 
> become a dull glow. She sighed, this was going to be fun. She sat 
beside the 
> main console and tried a few keys. Everything sparked, including 
the keys 
> she touched:
> 
> "You said it."
> 
> She turned to Firearm as she spoke, shaking her hand as a little 
smoke rose 
> from it. That was the second time this ship had shocked her. She 
groaned and 
> went to sit beside one of the active consoles. A sketchy image of 
the CF's 
> current status appeared before her. This was going to take forever. 
The 
> voice that boomed over her comm, however, snapped her out of 
whatever state 
> she just happened to be in. Optimus was back? The Neo Beast Wars 
had just 
> gotten a little more interesting.
> 
> *****
> 
> Tavatron:
> 
> The voice that had been speaking to her grew silent, only to be 
replaced by 
> another. Optimus was alive? Tavatron stopped walking and gazed 
across the 
> open plain. This was something she hadn't expected. Perhaps that 
was the 
> disturbance she had sensed:
> 
> *Guess again wolf.*
> 
> The voice was back, and seemed to have no intention of giving her 
any peace. 
> A hundred melancholy and then destructive emotions stormed her 
senses. If 
> she could, she would have ripped her own spark from her chest just 
to shut 
> it up:
> 
> *Come now, that's no way to greet an old friend.*
> 
> Tavatron growled beneath her breath, Dinobot's current predicament 
catching 
> her attention a few yards away. She smiled to herself, of all 
the 'bots the 
> creature had chose to land on... she couldn't help but chuckle 
softly. It 
> was a rather amusing site:
> 
> *Ah, so THAT's him. Not much of a warrior if you ask me.*
> 
> What little remained of Tavatron's patience vanished two seconds 
after the 
> voice had begun speaking about Dinobot. How could *she* know about 
him?! It 
> was impossible, even if *she* had been laying dormant all these 
years--
> 
> "I said shut-up."
> 
> To any 'bot within hearing distance she may have started sounding a 
little 
> crazy, but Tavatron didn't care about that right now. The voice in 
her head, 
> given enough time, would drive her crazy if she didn't shut it up 
soon. 
> Tavatron walked toward Dinobot, ignoring the voice as it rambled on 
about 
> some long forgotten military protocols. Dinobot wasn't coming 
inside, well, 
> her injuries could wait. She wanted to see where he was going:
> 
> [To DB] "Calm down, or it will just hold on tighter."
> 
> *Ha, you've always had the worst taste in friends.*
> 
> Tavatron ignored the voice as she tried to remove the small furry 
creature 
> from Dinobot's head.
